title: add dataproc_jars to templated fields in relevant dataproc operators
body:
### JIRA
- [X] My PR addresses the JIRA issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2411.  It allows jar files to be specified via templates, so that we can programmatically decide which jars to use.  I ran this proposed change by @fenglu-g and he agreed it was worthwhile.

### Description
- [X] Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:

This is a very minor change, adding only one field (`dataproc_jars`) to the list of templated fields for the various DataProc operators that submit jobs requiring jar files.  Note that this field is always called `dataproc_jars` in the operators, even though each operator's constructor has a different name for this field.  So the change may look a slight bit confusing, because it might appear that the templated field should vary by operator, but this is not the case.

### Tests
- [ ] My PR does not add tests because this is such a small change, and there are no tests currently in-place to test the templated fields.  However we have been running Airflow at Etsy with a subset of these changes (only the change for the `DataProcHadoopOperator`) successfully for about a month.

### Commits
- [X] My commits all reference JIRA issues in their subject lines, and I have squashed multiple commits if they address the same issue. In addition, my commits follow the guidelines from "[How to write a good git commit message](http://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/)":
    1. Subject is separated from body by a blank line
    2. Subject is limited to 50 characters
    3. Subject does not end with a period
    4. Subject uses the imperative mood ("add", not "adding")
    5. Body wraps at 72 characters
    6. Body explains "what" and "why", not "how"

### Documentation
- [ ] No documentation added because none exists which specifies the templated field list for dataproc operators.

### Code Quality
- [X] Passes `git diff upstream/master -u -- "*.py" | flake8 --diff`

title: [AIRFLOW-2213] Add Quoble check operator
body:
Make sure you have checked _all_ steps below.

### JIRA
- [x] My PR addresses the following [Airflow JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW/) issues and references them in the PR title. For example, "[AIRFLOW-XXX] My Airflow PR"
    - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2213


### Description
- [x] Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:

This extends CheckOperator and ValueCheckOperator for Qubole Commands.
It also adds another optional parameter called `results_parser_callable` which 
is a python_callable that should hold the logic to parse a list of rows returned by 
the Qubole command and return a list of records on which the checks have to be 
performed. By default, only the first row is parsed. 


### Tests
- [x] My PR adds the following unit tests __OR__ does not need testing for this extremely good reason:
- Adds qubole_check_operator tests to check 
       - if the operator passes if the query result is within a permissible range of values. 
       - if the operator fails if the query results is not with a permissible limit. 
       - if pass_value gets templatized properly.
       - if the operator fails, it contains Qubole command related information in the exception 
          message.
- Adds `qubole_check_hook` tests to test the default parse_first_row method in case of different query results.
 

### Commits
- [x] My commits all reference JIRA issues in their subject lines, and I have squashed multiple commits if they address the same issue. In addition, my commits follow the guidelines from "[How to write a good git commit message](http://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/)":

    4. Subject uses the imperative mood ("add", not "adding")
    5. Body wraps at 72 characters
    6. Body explains "what" and "why", not "how"

title: [AIRFLOW-2222] Implement GoogleCloudStorageHook.rewrite
body:
### JIRA
This adds the ability to avoid error `413 Payload Too Large` when copying GCS files over 5 TB or between locations and/or storage classes, as described in  [AIRFLOW-2222](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2222). Since this issue appears only in very specific circumstances, it does not resolve the issue automatically, but gives the DAG authors a mechanism to circumvent it.

### Description
Adds the `GoogleCloudStorageHook.rewrite` method, which calls the API endpoint of the same name and keeps calling it until the whole file is transferred.

title: [AIRFLOW-2357] Add persistent volume for the logs
body:
The logs are kept inside of the worker pod. By attaching a persistent disk we keep the logs and make them available for the webserver.

Right now, when a pod exits, the log is lost forever because it is still in the container. By mounting a persistent volume we can easily fix this and this allows us to have logs on our local machines (minikube). In production you might want to write your logs to GCS/S3/etc.

- [x] Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:

title: [AIRFLOW-2330] Do not append destination prefix if not given
body:
Addresses [AIRFLOW-2330](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2330).

### Description
The change introduces a check whether the `destination_object` parameter was given when using a wildcard (`*`) in the `source_object` parameter. If `destination_object` resolves to `False`, e.g. when not given (the default value is `None`) or is an empty string, the `destination_object` path is simply the `source_object` path.

It also includes some minor updates to docs and log messages.

title: [AIRFLOW-2326] Remove duplicate GCS to GCS operator
body:
Addresses [AIRFLOW-2326](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2326) "Duplicate GCS copy operator".

### Description
This patch removes one of the two operators with the same functionality. Out of the two, I have removed the `gcs_copy_operator` for two reasons:

1. The other one, `gcs_to_gcs.GoogleCloudStorageToGoogleCloudStorageOperator` follows the naming structure of other operators that move data (e.g. `gcs_to_bq.GoogleCloudStorageToBigQueryOperator`).
2. `GoogleCloudStorageToGoogleCloudStorageOperator` has a bit more functionality, allowing for moving files (i.e. deleting the originals). This pattern can be used for extending the moving functionality to e.g. `rewrite`, as I propose in [AIRFLOW-2222](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2222).

### Description
- [x] Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:

Currently, S3FileTransformOperator downloads the whole file from S3
before transforming and uploading it. Adding extraction feature using
S3 Select to this operator improves its efficiency and usablitily.

This PR upgrades boto3 to 1.7.0+, since [it supports S3 Select from that version](https://github.com/boto/boto3/blob/develop/CHANGELOG.rst#170).
I checked [boto3's Upgrading Notes](https://boto3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guide/upgrading.html) and confirmed that changes referred there doesn't affect Airflow.

body:

2. Also updated related unit test
